servinfo.title: Air Bag Diagnostic System Check Flow

item.ptxt: Be sure to perform Air Bag Diagnostic System Check before starting diagnosis according to each flow.
When measurement of resistance or voltage is required in the flow, use a tester along with a correct terminal adapter from special tool (Connector test adapter kit).
When a check for proper connection is required, refer to Inspection of Intermittent and Poor Connections .
If an open circuit in the air bag wire harness damaged, connector or terminal is found, replace the wire harness, connectors and terminals as an assembly.

ptxt.emph: Step 1: Check “AIR BAG” warning lamp and circuits.
Step 2: Check that “AIR BAG” warning lamp lights.
Step 3: Check that “AIR BAG” warning lamp flashes 6 times after ignition switch is turned ON.
Step 4: Check that history code(s) is in SDM memory.
Step 5: Check that current code is in SDM memory.

test1.ptxt: Make sure that battery voltage is about 11 V or higher.
Note “AIR BAG” warning lamp as ignition switch is turned ON.

testgroup.question: Does “AIR BAG” warning lamp come ON when ignition switch is turned ON?

action.ptxt: Proceed to “AIR BAG” Warning Lamp Does Not Come ON .

testgroup.question: Does “AIR BAG” warning lamp come ON steady?

action.ptxt: Proceed to “AIR BAG” Warning Lamp Comes ON Steady .

testgroup.question: Does “AIR BAG” warning lamp turn OFF, after flashing 6 times?

action.ptxt: “AIR BAG” warning lamp circuit is in good condition. Go to Step 4.
“AIR BAG” warning lamp circuit is in good condition. Go to Step 5.

testgroup.ptxt: Check DTC referring to DTC Check .
testgroup.question: Is “NO CODES” displayed on SUZUKI scan tool?

action.ptxt: Air bag system is in good condition.

paragroup.ptxt: An intermittent trouble has occurred at some place.
Check the connector harness, etc. related to the sensed DTC.
Refer to Inspection of Intermittent and Poor Connections .
Then clear DTC (referring to DTC Clearance .) and repeat this flow.

testgroup.ptxt: Check DTC referring to DTC Check .
testgroup.question: Is “NO CODES” displayed on SUZUKI scan tool?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good SDM and recheck.
Check and repair according to flow corresponding to that DTC.
